subtitle: Introduction to Root-Cause Health - 3 Modules + Final Exam
target_audience: Women aged 35-55+ experiencing unexplained symptoms, career changers curious about functional medicine, anyone who feels dismissed by conventional medicine and wants to understand their health better
difficulty_description: Beginner - No medical background required. This mini course introduces functional medicine concepts in simple, relatable language through storytelling and real case studies
format: Written lessons + Self-assessment exercises + Final Exam
course_description: Discover why you've been feeling tired, gaining weight, and struggling with symptoms your doctors can't explain. This free mini diploma introduces the 7 Body Systems Model and shows you exactly how functional medicine finds root causes that conventional medicine misses. Complete all modules and pass the final exam to earn your Mini Diploma certificate.

instructor.name: Sarah
instructor.credentials: Former ICU Nurse, Certified Functional Medicine Practitioner
instructor.story: After 15 years as an ICU nurse, Sarah burned out completely - exhausted, overweight, anxious, and running on coffee and adrenaline. Conventional medicine offered only antidepressants and told her to 'reduce stress.' Functional medicine saved her life, and now she trains others to become the practitioners they wish they had found.

learning_outcomes: Understand the difference between conventional symptom-based medicine and root-cause functional medicine
Learn the 7 Body Systems Model and how dysfunction in one system affects all others
Discover the Root-Cause Pyramid and the correct order for healing
See how functional medicine connects the dots that conventional medicine misses through a real case study
Identify which body system may be your primary issue

case_study_details.client_profile: 42-year-old working mom, two kids, full-time job
presenting_symptoms: Weight gain (20 lbs in 3 years, especially midsection)
conventional_medicine_response: Try eating less and exercising more
functional_findings: Gut dysfunction: Low stomach acid, SIBO, leaky gut
Cortisol dysregulation: High morning cortisol, 3am spikes, HPA axis dysfunction
Estrogen dominance: High estrogen, low progesterone, sluggish liver detox
Nutrient deficiencies: Low B12, ferritin, Vitamin D, magnesium
